definition: at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: The inaugurate parade was still going on.
sentences.chinese: 當時就職典禮正在舉行。

sentences.english: A crowd of great magnitude attended the President's inauguration.
sentences.chinese: 數以萬記的人蔘加了總統的就職典禮。

sentences.english: Every four years America inaugurates a president.
sentences.chinese: 美國每四年一次總統就職典禮。

sentences.english: Next week's inauguration also bears witness to America's awesome power of self-renewal.
sentences.chinese: 下週的就職典禮將正式見證美國自我振興的神奇力量。

sentences.english: Naval cadets in President John F. Kennedy's Inauguration Parade. Washington, Dc', US. 1961
sentences.chinese: 海軍士官生方陣在肯尼迪總統就職典禮的閱兵儀式上。

sentences.english: Clinton arrived to attend the inauguration of President Hamid Karzai.
sentences.chinese: 克林頓是前來參加卡爾扎伊總統就職典禮的。

sentences.english: The inauguration of the Linux-based economy?
sentences.chinese: 這就是以Linux爲基礎的經濟的就職典禮嗎？

sentences.english: New staff of Honolulu Lung Doo Benevolent Society took office on Jan. 1st.
sentences.chinese: 檀香山隆都從善堂1月1日舉行新年度職員就職典禮。
